name: Abbey Court B&B

reviews.text: We were extremely pleased with every thing from Abbey Court. Bren and Ger seemed like old friends with their interest in us and our actviities. The four of us stayed in 2 rooms that could be closed off to make a suite. We were unfortunate to be visiting the area in cold, rainy 'summer' weather and were delighted that Brendan helped us dry our clothes! The location was ideal for traveling around Kerry. In the 3 nights we were there we felt comforted at the end of a days journey to return to this house. From the house, you can easily walk to town for dinner or a drink. Kenmare is the perfect size for walking around to shop and find a good resturant. I would stay there again! Cheers.
reviews.title: charming house, family and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house is beautiful, location is great just 10 mins walk into town. The room was very clean but due to the wooden floors there is some noise. Breakfast was good although the problem we found was we had to wait each morning for breakfast as they only have 3 tables and lots of rooms.and sometimes was sat with other people. There was lots of choice of cereals and fresh fruit although it was in containers as it was bought from the supermarket think they could present it a little better. Apart from that the hosts were extremely friendly and helpful with lots of information about the area.
reviews.title: beautiful house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Abbey Court has a great location! It is walking distance to downtown and located on a beautiful lake which provides lots of peace and quiet. The landscaping is beautiful, the kitchen/living area are beautifully decorated and artwork is hung all around. We only saw one owner who was very friendly and the breakfast was okay. Basic cereal, cheese, fruit and an Irish Breakfast. My only problem, and it was a big one, was the bedroom linens were terrible! They were old and dirty looking. I'm sure they were washed but they were just so old looking that I'm not sure how clean they could actually get them. The sheets were paper thin and I'm glad I brought my own pillow. The bathroom was outdated but it was clean and the shower had great water pressure (which no other place in Ireland did!). I would not stay in Abbey Court again unless they invested in some quality towels and bed linens. The ones they had looked like they bought them used from a cheap old hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful exterior, Terrible Bedrooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Abbey Court is a FANTASTIC B&B. They serve the best breakfasts in the world! Choice of cheeses, cereals etc has to be seen to be believed. The owners are the friendliest people in Ireland, and NOTHING is too much trouble for them. They loaned us maps and spent ages drawing pictures helping us to find our way around. I cannot say enough good things about this B&B. Everyone i met agreed. They served a tray with drinks and biscuits to you EVERY TIME you returned - not just on arrival (this was the only B&B we stayed in that served that AT ALL!) The rooms are fantastic. The views are unreal!! Outside area for guest use . . incredible guest lounge rooms, and dining room! What else can i say? This is a spectacular, not to be missed B&B. If you can get in, stay here for sure!!
reviews.title: Best B&B in Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Abbey Court in Kenmare, Ireland is a wonderful place to stay. Family friendly, close to town, golfing, sightseeing, etc., this was a great two-night stay for us. The hosts, Brendan and Geraldine, made us feel very welcome as soon as we arrived, offering to "put a kettle on" for us to have a cup of afternoon tea. The property has a beautiful view of the bay from the upstairs bedroom windows, two sitting rooms, a large backyard area for kids to play, and more than adequate parking spaces (which was unusual for the B&Bs we stayed at in Ireland). The walk into town is advertised as 10 minutes, but that would be a brisk walk if not a jog. Its actually more like 15 minutes, but there is a sidewalk the whole way, and it is a pleasant walk past some interesting houses. There are plenty of pubs and restaurants in Kenmare to satisfy just about any taste. The friendliest we found were Ryans and O'Donnabahains (spelling might not be correct on that one!), both of which offered friendly service. Ryans only does sandwiches, but offers traditional Irish pub music in the evenings most nights. O'Donnabahains offers a full menu of very tasty food, including take-away (which is not that common in town). Kenmare is a great place to visit, and the Abbey Court is a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay!

likes.liked: — The view from the room, the quiet location, the friendly owners
likes.disliked: — We had to pay cash - no credit cards accepted

reviews.text: This was the absolute best B & B we stayed at during our 2 week visit to Ireland. A beautiful house, great service and the host's 5 year old daughter was perfect entertainment for our 20 month old son. We were super sad to leave and wished we could stay longer. Perfect base for traveling the Ring of Kerry. If you have children do not hesitate to stay here. They have cots for the babies and it was all set up before we got there. They also have 2 teenage boys that are very respectful, polite and helpful. Such a wonderful place.
reviews.title: Picture Perfect, Absolutely loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Abbey Court was a great place for a couple of nights. When I booked (direct), I was told straight away that the only room left was a small one so I knew to expect that. They remembered that they had promised to move us if another room became available but sadly it didn't. The larger rooms have great views over the estuary.
reviews.title: Book early for a view!

reviews.text: Abbey Court is a purpose built establishment with two large lounge areas. That's where you have to go if you want to watch TV because there are no TV's in the rooms.
reviews.title: A peaceful and lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was comfortable but as the walls are not solid, there is noise from the adjacent room.
reviews.title: Loved it! Very comfortable!

reviews.text: Breakfast was well done with a good variety of cereals, fresh fruit and yoghurt as well as the typical Irish breakfast. Plenty of fresh tea and plunger coffee.
reviews.title: Nice looking, but very indifferent owners

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the apartment over the garage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had had trouble with our car window being stuck down and appreciated the help from Brendan in trying to repair it. He found us some tools and plastic and tape. Thanks Brendan!
reviews.title: Great stay with great hosts

likes.disliked: — Although the property location is beautiful the walk could get long at the end of a night in town.

description: Abbey Court is a new purpose built B&B, situated on acres of landscaped gardens and just metres from the shore of Kenmare Bay, whilst also overlooking the Caha Mountains. Abbey Court is also a short stroll to town and has plenty of parking. A quiet off-the-road location for a good night's sleep and a warm welcome assured.
